metalign.beat

Class BeatTrackingModelState

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.generic.MidiModelState
      • metalign.beat.BeatTrackingModelState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MidiModelState>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FromBeatsBeatTrackingModelState, FromFileBeatTrackingModelState, HmmBeatTrackingModelState

    public abstract class BeatTrackingModelState
extends MidiModelState
    A BeatTrackingModelState is a MidiModelState which contains a List of Beats which has been created from the incoming MIDI data. In order to get these beats, the getBeats() method should be called.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 7 Sept, 2015

      The HierarchyModelState which these beats will be based on.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Check if this state has started yet. That is, have we placed any tatums yet.
        Returns:
        False if getBeatTimes() returns an empty list. False otherwise.

      • getTatumsPerMeasure

        public int getTatumsPerMeasure()
        Get the number of tacti which are present in each measure of the Beats of this state. This is needed because for a FromFileBeatTrackingModelState, the measures are incremented correctly, but for any other BeatTrackingModelState, this is not the case.
        Returns:
        The number of tacti per measure for a FromFileBeatTrackingModelState, or 0 for any other model.

      • isDuplicateOf

        public abstract boolean isDuplicateOf(BeatTrackingModelState state)
        Decide whether the given state is a duplicate of this one.
        Parameters:
        state - The state we want to check for a duplicate.
        Returns:
        True if the states are duplicates. False otherwise.
